messages.message:
https://aihub.preprod.instabase.com/hub/apps/45ef3b44-fefb-4ba5-aa20-4b718064b81d

Env: `PREPROD`
Product: `Converse: Chatbots`

Running queries with more than one document (using new `@ mentions`) with `Research mode OFF` toggles on `Research mode` after the query is generated, and the query itself is also run with `Research mode ON`.
1. Is `Research mode` required when running queries against more than 1 document at a time?
2. I feel like `Research mode` be toggled back to `OFF` rather than be left `ON`
    a. Should there be a warning or caution stating when `Research mode` will be enabled for the query since it might incur more unit consumption?
SS 1: Building query with `Research mode OFF`
SS 2: Running query with `Research mode OFF`
SS 3: Research mode used flag indicated post-query; also `Research mode toggled ON` automatically for subsequent queries
~@Brian thanks for reporting! This got fixed. Can you please check in the UAT environment.~

1. Is `Research mode` required when running queries against more than 1 document at a time?
    a. *Balaram:* Research mode (multstep) is not always needed for multi-doc queries. By default multistep-lite model will be used for the multi-doc queries
2. I feel like `Research mode` be toggled back to `OFF` rather than be left `ON`
    a. *Balaram:* Currently we are retaining the setting from the previous query. @avi any thoughts on this? Like retaining the research mode setting only for the query
@Brian can you please confirm whether the research mode is turned on automatically?

(I see your message was crossed out prior to this follow-up message, but sharing still for completeness/insight UAT exhibiting the same behavior https://aihub-uat.internal.instabase.com/hub/apps/2797464e-d694-4123-b9d5-4e6403fe0f24)

1. Is `Research mode` required when running queries against more than 1 document at a time?
    a. *Balaram:* Research mode (multstep) is not always needed for multi-doc queries. By default multistep-lite model will be used for the multi-doc queries
        i. Brian: It seems multi-doc queries (100% of the ones I have tested so far in both UAT and Preprod -- granted, that's not a large sample size :lil_nervous: -- have been automatically run using `Research mode ON` )
2. I feel like `Research mode` be toggled back to `OFF` rather than be left `ON`
    a. *Balaram:* Currently we are retaining the setting from the previous query. @avi any thoughts on this? Like retaining the research mode setting only for the query
        i. Brian: :ack: ; however, I do feel like settings from the previous query should only be retained whenever they were not automatically triggered. (IE settings should only be retained when manually set)
> can you please confirm whether the research mode is turned on automatically?
Yes, confirming that `Research mode` was toggled to `ON` automatically in all of my observed cases.
